page.title: 05The Village Hall, Mawdesley
page.content: Many new families have moved into Mawdesley over the past twenty years.Unlike the old days,many did not have connections with the church, so there was a need for a different kind of meeting place. Money to build it was raised in different ways,chiefly from "It's a Knockout" competitions,and in 1974 a new hall was opened.It has a large hall with a stage,smaller rooms and a bar. It is used by people of all ages in the village.It serves as a meeting place for the clinic,the playgroup,the Dramatic Society,the Badminton Club,the Tennis Club,the Youth Club and for private functions. It is run by a committee which is elected every year.
